meta.article_title: September 23, 2024 - The Only Thing That Matters

the_only_thing_that_matters.probleme: Mental focus drifts to past or future points.
the_only_thing_that_matters.diagnostic: Players dwell on previous mistakes or inflate the importance of the match, which harms performance.

debutant: Treat the next point as the only thing that matters so it gets your full attention.
Forget the previous point except for its tactical lesson for the upcoming point.

erreurs_a_eviter: Thinking of the next point as the most important thing in the world and making yourself nervous.
Ruminating on the last point beyond extracting a tactical takeaway.

meta.article_title: September 16, 2024 - Written Coaching Material for Table Tennis

written_coaching_material_for_table_tenn.probleme: Misconception that reading alone is pointless or sufficient for improvement.
written_coaching_material_for_table_tenn.diagnostic: Reading without practice does not build skill; reading can help guide practice, thinking, and tactics.

debutant: Use coaching articles and books as supplements and then practice what they describe.
intermediaire: Watch top players and/or learn from a coach in addition to reading.
Test tactical ideas from reading to see what works in play.
avance: Combine study, observation, coaching, and experimentation to refine strategy and tactics.

erreurs_a_eviter: Relying on reading alone without on-table practice.
Dismissing written material as useless for understanding tactics and development.

plan_your_one_minute_break.probleme: Ineffective or late use of the one-minute timeout.
plan_your_one_minute_break.diagnostic: Players wait until they are about to lose before calling it, limiting its impact.

debutant: Call the timeout when it can make a difference, not only at the brink of defeat.
intermediaire: Use the timeout to regain focus, think about tactics (alone or with a coach), rest, and/or let a hot opponent cool off.
Consider calling it mid-game when you begin to fall behind rather than after trailing 0–2.
avance: In some situations, use a timeout when on the verge of winning a game (e.g., serving up 10–8) to lock it in, provided it suits your focus style.

erreurs_a_eviter: Saving the timeout only for desperation at the end.
Calling a timeout when already completely unfocused without a plan for its use.

meta.article_title: September 2, 2024 - If Serving Practice is Drudgery Then Perhaps Your Serves Are Too Simple

if_serving_practice_is_drudgery_then_per.probleme: Boredom and limited development during serve practice due to overly simple serves.
if_serving_practice_is_drudgery_then_per.diagnostic: Overemphasis on basic placement without working on deception, spin variation, and depth/placement aggression.

debutant: Develop control of height, depth, and direction on basic serves.
intermediaire: Practice deception: disguise spin with fast racket movements and subtle contact changes.
Maximize spin; then learn to use identical motion to deliver no-spin by contacting near the handle.
Add fast and spinny aggressive serves to the middle and corners, and fast dead serves to the elbow.
avance: Blend heavy-spin, no-spin with identical motion, and fast/deep placements to jam the receiver and provoke errors.

erreurs_a_eviter: Practicing only simple serves for hours without deception or variation.
Ignoring the art and science of serve development.

meta.article_title: August 26, 2024 – What to Do in a Laugher Match

what_to_do_in_a_laugher_match.probleme: Losing focus and form in uncompetitive matches.
what_to_do_in_a_laugher_match.diagnostic: Assuming an easy win leads to loss of focus and degraded fundamentals.

debutant: Assume no match is a laugher; keep focus on every point.
intermediaire: Maintain normal fundamentals: loop against pushes and use the same shot choices you would versus stronger players.
Use the opportunity to work on serves and other fundamentals without neglecting focus.
avance: If conserving energy, push a bit more but avoid overdoing it so habits do not deteriorate.

erreurs_a_eviter: Coasting after an easy game and losing concentration.
Practicing poor habits by playing a different, lower-effort game.

the_loaded_push.probleme: Standard pushes get attacked; inability to stop big serve-and-loop.
the_loaded_push.diagnostic: Players think of the push as merely a safe backspin shot with 'good' backspin.
causes_communes: Mindset focused on safeness rather than maximum spin.
Insufficient use of forearm and wrist to graze the ball vigorously.

debutant: Change mindset from safety to 'How much backspin can I put on the ball?'
intermediaire: Graze the ball using both forearm and wrist to load heavy backspin so the opponent struggles to attack.
avance: Use loaded long pushes selectively along with other receives (short push, flip, loop against long serves) to be effective rather than merely safe.

erreurs_a_eviter: Pushing just to keep the ball in play with moderate backspin.
Assuming most serves must be pushed back rather than choosing the best option.

meta.article_title: August 12, 2024 – Practice Until You Can’t Do It Wrong

practice_until_you_cant_do_it_wrong.probleme: Fundamentals break down under pressure due to shallow practice.
practice_until_you_cant_do_it_wrong.diagnostic: Players stop at 'I can do it' instead of ingraining skills until nearly unerring; drills are run too fast to build consistency.
causes_communes: Practicing at speeds where either partner is inconsistent.
Insufficient repetition to make technique automatic.

debutant: Slow drills to a speed where both players are consistent.
Strive for perfection in rote drills to ingrain fundamentals.
intermediaire: Block, loop, and rally at repeatable tempos so errors arise only when the opponent varies the ball.
Increase speed only after high consistency is achieved.

erreurs_a_eviter: Declaring a skill 'good enough' after minimal success.
Drilling too fast to build reliability.

the_slow_spinny_loop.probleme: Underuse and poor technique for the slow, spinny loop.
the_slow_spinny_loop.diagnostic: Players default to power loops and execute slow loops with insufficient spin, making them easy to attack.
causes_communes: Lack of knowledge that a slow spinny loop is an aggressive, full-power stroke focused on topspin.
Taking the ball too high and directing power too far forward.

debutant: Understand that the slow spinny loop is meant to create extreme topspin, not a safe, weak loop.
intermediaire: Let the ball drop (often below table level); bend knees and use legs to drive mostly up while still moving slightly forward.
Use a continuous motion: legs → hips/waist → shoulder → forearm → wrist.
At contact, snap forearm and wrist while grazing the ball to create heavy topspin.
If balls go long, contact more on top and slightly more forward, especially versus lighter backspin.
avance: Practice sequence: serve backspin, receive heavy push, execute slow, spinny loop with maximum topspin; repeat to build high consistency from spin pulling the ball down.

exercices_complementaires.description: Server gives backspin; partner pushes heavy; player performs slow, spinny loop emphasizing upward leg drive and fine grazing; repeat for consistency.

erreurs_a_eviter: Treating the stroke as a soft, safe loop.
Taking contact too high and sending balls long.

meta.article_title: July 29, 2024 - Strategy Requires Thought. Tactics Requires Observation.

strategy_requires_thought_tactics_requir.probleme: Confusion between strategy (long-term development) and tactics (winning now).
strategy_requires_thought_tactics_requir.diagnostic: Players may plan only for development or only react to opponents, instead of using both modes appropriately.

debutant: Differentiate strategy (long-term development of your game) from tactics (immediate match adjustments).
intermediaire: Example strategic plan: pair an effective loop with a good short backspin serve to draw long pushes to loop.
Use observation during matches to adjust when opponents receive and block in ways that lower loop percentage (e.g., quick angled heavy pushes, short pushes, flips, effective blocks).
avance: Modify serving patterns (more sidespin/topspin or more deep serves) or push more to find a better ball to loop; afterward, refine long-term training so the same opponent actions will not trouble you next time.

erreurs_a_eviter: Using strategic plans without tactical adjustment during matches.
Reacting tactically without longer-term plans to shore up weaknesses.
